results.content: This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment including, without limitation, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, lay-off, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Our commitment to equal opportunity employment applies to all persons involved in our operations and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any team member, including supervisors and co-workers. This policy governs all aspects of employment, including selection, promotion, job assignment, compensation, discipline, termination, and access to benefits and training. results.content: EAP (Employee Assistance Program) Capsule recognizes that all team members go through difficult times. Capsule provides a benefit for team members and their families to receive counseling at no cost beginning on the date of hire. The free counseling is limited to a maximum of five visits per year, per issue for you and your dependents on Capsule benefits. Additional counseling should be coordinated through your medical insurance plan. Leaves of Absence A leave of absence is a way for team members who are experiencing out-of-the-ordinary circumstances to take time off work. Common reasons are childbirth, adoption, caring for an ill family member, serious health conditions or military leave. PTO and paid sick leave and other leave accruals do not accrue while a team member is on a leave of absence, regardless of whether they receive any wage replacement payments. The leave policies below are applicable for full-time team members.

results.content: Appropriate disciplinary action will be taken against any team member who violates this policy. Based on the seriousness of the offense, disciplinary action may include termination of employment. Managers and supervisors who knowingly allow or tolerate discrimination, harassment, or retaliation, including the failure to immediately report such misconduct to People Operations are in violation of this policy and subject to discipline. Capsule has a zero tolerance policy against any type of retaliation against a team member for coming forward with a claim. The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission ("EEOC") and equivalent state agencies will accept and investigate charges of unlawful discrimination and harassment at no charge to the complaining party. The nearest office of the EEOC and equivalent state agencies can be found in your local telephone directory or online at www.eeoc.gov.

results.content: Discretionary Personal Leave of Absence Personal leave may be granted for justifiable reasons at Capsule’s discretion. Personal leave will be without pay. However, if the team member has accrued but unused PTO the PTO must be exhausted. During a discretionary personal leave of absence, an eligible team member’s coverage in Capsule’s health plan will end at the end of the month in which their leave begins. Vesting of any equity will also stop during the personal leave. Team members will be eligible to continue equity vesting and enroll in Capsule benefits on the first day they return to work. To apply for a personal leave of absence, please contact both your direct supervisor and the People Team at peopleops@capsule.com at least two (2) weeks in advance of the absence, if possible. If granted, the leave will be for a stated period of time, at which point the team member is expected to return to work.

results.content: DPTO does not supersede Capsule’s policies for illness or injury, disability, parental or family leave, bereavement, jury duty, court appearances, military duty, or other time off or leaves of absence (some of which are mandated by applicable law), such as Capsule’s policies regarding the Family and Medical Leave Act and Military Leave. Capsule permits and expects team members who are qualified to take a leave of absence to do so. DPTO does not apply to leaves of absence and DPTO cannot be used to compensate team members for reasons covered by leaves of absence (including in situations where a team member is not approved for a leave of absence). For the avoidance of doubt, DPTO is not available for use during absences related to a team member’s illness or injury or the illness or injury of a family member, which are covered by separate policies, including the Sick Leave policy. DPTO also may not be used to extend a leave of absence, or a duration of paid sick leave.
